topic.title: COREOTN Abstract

draft-comment.author: hookerje
draft-comment.i: [DDD/HWS] Include this abstract. It provides a very clear and concise overview of what the Subsystem does, without going into excessive detail. The generic Abstract text in section 2 above this section will of course not be included in the DDD/HWS as it has no real value in that context.

body.p: The COREOTN subsystem processes the ODUk/OPUk layer for the OTN Protocol. It provides the necessary ODU layer RX/TX framing to perform OTN fault isolation, defect processing and performance monitoring to evaluate the degradation or failure of the OTN link. The COREOTN contains multiple stages of ODTUjk MUX/DMX and ODTUCN MUX/DMX to multiplex between different ‘orders’ of ODUk’s and performing appropriate framing. The subsystem provides four distinct interfaces: COPI, LINEOTN (OTUk layer), SYSOTN (client OTUk layer) and MAPOTN (to demap ODUk’s into other protocol clients).The COREOTN contains a single stage ODTUCN MUX/DMX to multiplex between ODUk and ODUC and to perform appropriate framing. The subsystem provides two distinct interfaces: LINEOTN (OTUk layer), and MAPOTN (to demap ODUk’s into other protocol clients). The Subsystem processes up to 600G of ODU traffic from each of these interfaces, except COPI which can only process up to 500G, except COPI or NFIC which can only process up to 500G. The OTU interface bandwidth may be 600G even when the COREOTN is processing less than 600G. For example, 2x250G of ODUk may be carried over 2x300G of OTU interfaces. Depending on the interface the supported ODU rates are from ODU0ODU4 up to ODUflex (600G) or ODUC6. There are optional encryption taps to be able to encrypt the OPU payload at HO, Client or towards the fabric.

The Subsystem provides 3 ‘control’ blocks that enable Overhead add/drop functionality for custom overhead handling, a GCC transcode block (only HO) for a communication channel and an RCP (Ring control port) for defect and remote information handling to enable Hardware APS or SNC protocols in systems. In most systems, this subsystem will need to be reconfigured efficiently to enable OTN SNC protocols for fabric connected interfaces and supports fast reconfiguration times.
